meanings.definition: To beat or flog with a knout.
meanings.sent1: The cruel ruler knouted the prisoner for disobedience.
meanings.sent2: The soldier knouted the criminal as a form of punishment.
meanings.sent3: The teacher jokingly threatened to knout the students if they didn't finish their homework.
meanings.sent4: The storm knouted the trees with its fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: The angry waves seemed to knout the shore relentlessly.

meanings.definition: A whip with a lash of leather thongs.
meanings.sent1: The executioner used a knouted to inflict punishment.
meanings.sent2: She saw the knouted hanging on the wall of the old barn.
meanings.sent3: The cowboy's trusty knouted was always by his side.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the knouted cracking echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design on the knouted made it a unique piece of art.
